entry.title: Reland "Add use counter for web app AppTitle feature."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 89a6dc26c14efeed22a368288e63b91d11ff9da2 which reverted the original CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277088.



Reason for revert: Tests were failing due to use counter event logging not always firing at our validation point. To address this, I've updated tests to force this event to flush by navigating to about:blank page and explicitly fetching events from all child processes before we validate it.

entry.title: CCA: Wait for initial CameraInfo before startReconfigure
entry.content:
If system is locked before the first update of CameraInfo, CCA can't

resume because it hits an assertion that CameraInfo is not null in

startReconfigure(). This change ensures CCA waits for the first

CameraInfo update before startReconfigure is invoked to prevent an

assertion failure.



Bug: b:321623703

Test: Check CCA can resume when closing lid right after opening CCA

entry.title: Add test verifying subdomains of token origin can't disable TopLevelTpcd
entry.content:
While subdomain matching origin trial tokens can be used by subdomains

of the origin stored in the token (the "token origin") to enable a

trial, a document without the token present must be loaded from the

token origin itself in order to disable it.



The TopLevelTpcd deprecation (AKA reverse-origin) trial's state for a

given origin (and its subdomains) is mirrored in content settings,

introducing additional confusion. This CL adds a browser test to verify

that the behavior described above holds true for the TopLevelTpcd trial.



Bug: NONE

Change-Id: Ib3bbc66f9517d13fb14fd4320e635ccd5f8d59ec

entry.title: Reland "Use a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit a7fa6958b26d809a90af45445a28bf171bd20d9a



This reland avoids adding the unsafe_buffers_paths.txt file as an

input to GN targets that are not C/C++.



Original change's description:

> Use a clang plugin to emit and filter -Werror=unsafe-buffer-usage

>

> Part 2 of 2 for "Allow incremental adoption of -Wunsafe-buffer-usage

> at a per-file (either header or source file) granularity."

>

> A key difficulty of spanification is that of incremental application

> of the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage warning:

> * First, textual includes mean that it's not possible to turn on the

> warning for a header file only. It has to be enabled for a cc file

> at a time.

> * Then, enabling it for a cc file also transitively applies it to every

> header it touches.

> * And, enabling it on separate cc files requires splitting up our GN

> build targets quite awkwardly, and will require a huge amount of

> churn.

>

> Clang itself does not provide a way to specify a warning should be

> enabled only for certain files (crbug.com/41497066).

>

> In https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323341

> we introduced the 'unsafe-buffers' plugin, which is able to apply

> -Wunsafe-buffer-usage at the individual file level. In this CL, we

> enable use of the plugin, and remove other existing mechanisms.

>

> We add a list of checked file-path prefixes in

> //build/config/unsafe_buffers_paths.txt which are read by the plugin

> so that individual headers, cc files, and eventually directories

> can have the warning enabled for them in an incremental manner

> without requiring changes to the plugin or clang rolls.

>

> In order to rebuild targets when the paths change, the path prefixes

> file is added to the `inputs` set in GN for every C/C++ target.

> However Reclient does not respect `inputs` for C/C++. It must for

> Rust, to support `include!()`, and it will need to in the future to

> support `#embed` in C. A workaround is added for this file in

> //build/config/rbe.gni that just sticks the file in the command

> line to rewrapped explicitly, passing it as `-inputs`. See

> crbug.com/326584510 for this Reclient bug.

>

> We remove the UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_BEGIN and

> UNSAFE_BUFFERS_INCLUDE_END macros which were used to wrap header

> includes and exclude them from unsafe-buffers checks as they

> no longer provide additional value. Headers will only be checked

> if they are opted in through the unsafe-buffers plugin.

>

> And we remove the -Wunsafe-buffer-usage command line argument

> from cflags as we use the plugin to do this job now. One day when

> the codebase is clean, we can turn this warning on globally. The

> dream.

>

> Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510

> Change-Id: I03c43c2a6ab5552f58c6fcd0cb885ad2ce1460d7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5324046

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1267242}



Bug: 40284755, 41497066, 326584510

Change-Id: I1023be17b36ac05dfc5806ce14ff745c246a0a63

entry.content:

implies whether or not a randomized response should be generated.



This change improves some local benchmarks that always generate a

randomized response (by setting epsilon=0) by around 5%.

entry.title: Change CoreText API calls for getting fonts from family in Mac
entry.content:
We were getting the list of fonts from specified family by creating a

CTFontDescriptor with the desired family attribute and then creating a

list of fonts in family using

CTFontCollectionCreateMatchingFontDescriptors.



This CL changes that to retrieve all system fonts using

CTFontCollectionCreateFromAvailableFonts to get the collection of all

system fonts available (including deprecated ones) and

CTFontCollectionCreateMatchingFontDescriptorsForFamily to retrieve the

fonts with the desired family name from the collection of all fonts.

Several measurements show that this approach generally works a bit

faster, compare [0].



[0] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aX89AiZlrShVbVbXqlEyPKxyV72UFTvGHMyJJZRVzCg/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 41487890

The fix is to parse the input h264 NAUL type and retrieve

entry.title: Use base::HeapArray in GetFontTable
entry.content:
This change is being made as part of a code health rotation project

to convert all uses of std::unique_ptr with base::HeapArray.

std::unique_ptr does not automatically preserve the size of the

allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc bounds checks. In contrast,

base::HeapArray does track the size. Please see the linked bug

for more information.



Important note: we still have to extract the raw pointer and size from the HeapArray to pass directly third_party APIs like Skia and harfbuzz. Crossing the third-party boundary is not currently in scope but will be addressed in the future.



Bug: 40285824,326459076

entry.title: webnn: Encourage use of MLActivation::Kind()
entry.content:
Currently, checking the kind of an MLActivation is often done by

checking the kind of the MLOperator it owns. This isn't quite right,

since Activation and Operation kinds are distinct (the Activation enum

is a subset of the values in the Operator enum)



Unfortunately there is existing code which would be a mess to refactor

that relies on checking the MLOperator::Kind() of an MLActivation, so

this CL merely exposes MLActivation::Kind() and encourages its use

entry.title: Don't load user32.dll and gdi32.dll in sandboxed browser test processes
entry.content:
Browser tests on Windows run the entire browser stack, including the

sandbox. One sandbox mitigation is 'win32k lockdown', which prevents

loading gdi32.dll or anything that depends on it in the process (like

user32.dll or shell32.dll). Today they load anyway due to sandbox

interceptions on these OS dlls.



In preparation for the removal of these interceptions, modify code that

attempts to load these dlls in every sandboxed browser test process:

1) Add a delayload config where these dlls are statically linked

2) Add IsUser32AndGdi32Available checks for win32k lockdown for code

which calls in to these DLLs.



These changes have the tests run under a similar environment as retail

chrome, so the tested behavior more closely matches shipping code.



Bug: 326277735

entry.title: [pdf-a11y]: be more assertive in resetting the plugin serializer
entry.content:
The PDF a11y tree and serializer have a tenuous stitch to the ancestor

nodes. In particular, any subtree clears in the ancestry nodes require

the serializer to be cleared. If not, potential bugs like the one

referenced occur where descendants in PDF are not re-sent.



In the past, we dealt with this by always serializing the entire PDF

a11y tree i.e.

https://crrev.com/c/5274721



Though this "works", it always means shoving a lot of data into an IPC

to the browser. Consider a 200 page PDF.



This change attempts to cover more of the cases that may arise in which

we want to reset the plugin serializer:

- calls to AXObjectCacheImpl::Reset. These come from requests from the

browser to re-send all data.

- update->node_id_to_clear > 0 during

AXObjectCacheImpl::SerializeDirtyObjectsAndEvents. THis change makes

it so that we reset the plugin serializer for *any* node clearing (its

subtree) even if the update contains no embedded objects.



R=aleventhal@chromium.org



Bug: 326733014

Test: cq

entry.title: Fix timeout in svg-mouse-listener a11y test
entry.content:
The recommended approach to make a crash test asynchronous is to use

reftest-wait. Unfortunately, test-driver does not work with ref-tests.

The fix is to pull the test out of crashtests and author as a promise

test. This is the only a11y crash test that uses test-driver, and

thus, the only one that is affected.



The test needs to be asynchronous to avoid a memory leak. The reason is

due to the fact that we have armed an event listener that is never

triggered unless we wait. A crash-test only waits until onload is complete.

entry.title: Switch UPFs to use ThreadPoolExecutor
entry.content:
Switches unexpected pass finder code to use

concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor instead of the third party pathos

module. This has a number of benefits while retaining a very similar

API surface:



1. Reduced system memory usage since everything is handled in one

process and we aren't forking a process that has potentially

gigabytes of results stored (initial attempts to use spawn instead of

fork for process creation did not seem to have an effect)

2. Reduced latency and memory usage when merging results since results

are handled as they become available instead of all at once at the

end. This benefit could have been achieved via pathos' imap(), as

well.

3. Less reliance on third party code. While pathos does a good job of

improving on Python's multiprocessing module, mostly by

automagically handling pickling issues that multiprocessing complains

about, it is still a third party dependency that is better not to

keep around if we can use purely built-ins instead.



This has the potential to be a bit slower than the pathos implementation

if multiple queries finish at the same time due to Python's lack of true

multithreading with the default interpreter, but in practice, that does

not seem to be a significant issue.



Anecdotally, this resulted in a ~20 GB reduction in peak memory usage

locally when running the WebGPU UPF with 100 samples and 4

concurrent jobs, which works out to 75-80% less memory.



Bug: 326277799

Change-Id: I5d75ad16e2a06e8f8d4a094e56c03b694936f813

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5347480

entry.title: Move family matching by postscript name to AppKit
entry.content:
Postscript font matching based on AppKit is faster than postscript font

matching based on CoreText. This caused several performance

regressions, compare issue 41487890. Similar issue was filed in Apple

Feedback Assistant, FB13615032: CoreText's API for retrieving all system

fonts from desired family is working much slower than AppKits

`availableMembersOfFontFamily`.



This CL changes matching by family name logic to the following:

We first attempt to find a match by `desired_family_string` family

name in the `MatchFontFamily`. If we failed to do so, we then try to

find a match by postscript name. There are two ways of postscript

matching: using CoreText and AppKit API, which can be switched with

the new runtime flag, with the default AppKit API approach. If during

postscript matching we found font that has desired traits we will

return it, otherwise we will do one more pass of family matching with

the found with postscript matching font's family name.



Since in this CL family matching is performed before postscript

matching and we don't have a comparison between matched postscript and

family names and the desired name, it is also fixing the issue

327473680, which was caused because the matched font name in the bug

did not match the desired name.



In AppKit postscript matching we use `NSFontManager.availableFonts`,

that does not include the document supported fonts, compare issue

1000542, while CoreText's `CTFontCreateWithName` includes document

supported fonts, see [0]. This causes matching results for CoreText and

AppKit postscript matching to differ. Hence the tests with deprecated

(document supported) fonts need to be rebaselined.



[0] https://support.apple.com/en-us/108939



Bug: 41487890, 327473680

Change-Id: I5a230f5efb43d1896e2bdcc8bfb3cef612ac243f

entry.title: Introduce a general navigation state keep alive object
entry.content:
This moves the keepalive behaviour that was previously on

PolicyContainerHost to a separate NavigationStateKeepAlive class. The

Blink mirror mojo remote mechanism remains the same, but the definitions

have moved.

There is now one mojo UniqueReceiverSet per storage partition.

Previously, there was one per PolicyContainerHost (and thus

RenderFrameHost). This UniqueReceiverSet can have receivers for multiple

RenderFrameHosts, and multiple receivers per RenderFrameHost (e.g., for

multiple queued navigations).



behaviour change



Test: Covered by NavigationBrowserTest.FormSubmission* tests, minimal

entry.title: Inject keychain access group to unexportable keys
entry.content:
Pass a configuration object to the unexportable keys provider that lets

the embedder inject a keychain access group. The access group must be

backed by a corresponding entitlement. Chrome's provisioning profile

should already include the chosen string.



The group .unexportable-keys was chosen as a catch-all for unexportable

key clients. If in the future it was desired to partition clients into

different groups, it would be a matter of teaching the components

service about them.



The device trust code passes the existing .devicetrust group.



Also, drive-by making some mock tests available on all platforms since

they do not seem to be platform-specific.

entry.title: RendererUpdater: Remove IdentityManager observation
entry.content:
Before this CL, RendererUpdater sent updates to renderers whenever the

Sync-consented account changed. This was because in the past, it sent

the "has primary account" bit to the renderer, but as of

crrev.com/c/1967245 that's not the case anymore. So those updates were

just no-ops.

This CL removes that logic.

As a side effect, this removes a ConsentLevel::kSync usage.

entry.title: [accessibility] Deflake accessibility tests that use guest views
entry.content:
PDFOCRIntegrationTests use an AccessibilityNotificationWaiter on an

outer WebContents and wait for changes to the accessibility tree

generated by renderers for an inner WebContents. In some cases, the

outer WC's tree is rooted at about:blank.

AccessibilityNotificationWaiter has a special carve-out to ignore events

generated while about:blank is loading, which is a problem in this case.



In this CL, we gently change the waiter's OnAccessibilityEvent so that

it doesn't ignore events to an inner WC (e.g., one hosting a PDF) when

the outer is about:blank.

entry.title: iwa: Overhaul web app database storage schema for IWAs
entry.content:
The main purpose of this CL is to change the database schema for IWAs:

- "InstalledBundle" becomes "OwnedBundle", and no longer uses a path,

but instead just a folder name to reference the bundle. In the future,

this will allow us to use "owned" bundles for both prod mode and

optionally also dev mode. Getting the full path to the bundle requires

knowledge of where the profile directory is located. The benefit of

this is that it bakes the invariant "bundle must be in the profile

directory" directly into the type system, instead of relying on

runtime checks.

- "DevModeBundle" becomes "UnownedBundle". This is meant for bundles

that the browser does not own (hence should never cleanup or move).

- "DevModeProxy" becomes "Proxy".



We map these new types to newly introduced classes:

- `IwaStorageOwnedBundle`

- `IwaStorageUnownedBundle`

- `IwaStorageProxy`



Code that can work with either of these can use their wrapper class,

`IsolatedWebAppStorageLocation`.



Whether or not a storage location represents a dev-mode-only location

is no longer hard-coded based on class names, but should instead be

queried via the new `dev_mode()` getters available on all of these.

While this internally currently maps to hard-coded values, this will

change once owned bundles can be used in dev mode as well

(crrev.com/c/5318496).



`IsolatedWebAppStorageLocation` currently still contains a few methods

used for compatibility with `IsolatedWebAppLocation`, but these will go

away as part of another CL (crrev.com/c/5318031).



Also, we now allow updating between different storage location types, as

long as both types are either both dev mode or both non-dev-mode. In the

future, this would allow us to, for example, update an owned dev-mode

bundle to a non-owned dev-mode bundle (see crrev.com/c/5318496). It

remains impossible to update between different Web Bundle ID types

(proxy vs. Ed25519 IDs), but this is not enforced on the storage layer,

but as part the `IsolatedWebAppUrlInfo` being different between the two.



is either temporary or part of the untested dev mode UI.



Low-Coverage-Reason: LARGE_SCALE_REFACTOR The code with low coverage

Fixed: 40239527, 325595783

Bug: 287594073, 326044349

entry.title: Separate CC suggestion data generation from object creation
entry.content:
ASG::GetSuggestionForCreditCards calls GetOrderedCardsToSuggest, which

fetches the cards from the PDM and does some deduplication and filering.

Then it proceeds to create Suggestion objects.



While doing so, it does some additional filtering for the cards, which

is then repeated in other functions using GetOrderedCardsToSuggest

without GetSuggestionsForCreditCards (e.g. TTF)



This CL moves all logic related to getting CreditCards to suggest to

GetOrderedCardsToSuggest, so that Suggestion creation happens only

after the correct data was fetched.

entry.title: `cargo vet` audit of the `cfg-if` crate.
entry.content:
The `cfg-if` crate's required audit criteria used to be met via

`rule-of-two-safe-to-deploy` certification imported from ChromiumOS,

because before https://crrev.com/c/5328059 we used to say (in Chromium,

but not in ChromiumOS) that `rule-of-two-safe-to-deploy` also `implies =

["safe-to-deploy", "ub-risk-1"]` After https://crrev.com/c/5328059 we

need to recertify this crate via other means.



Since this is a really small crate, it seems easiest and most

straightforward to just do the full audit and certify this crate as

`"safe-to-deploy"`, `"does-not-implement-crypto"`, and `"ub-risk-0"`.

entry.title: Centralize handling of logging switches
entry.content:
This CL refactors where logging related command line switches

are propagated to child processes. Rather than being done by

process specific hosts these flags are centralized in the

child process launcher helper. This change may allow logging

from more process types but otherwise should have no functional

changes.



Affected flags:



--disable-logging

--enable-logging

--log-file

--log-level

--v

--vmodule

entry.title: [Autofill] Reset AutofillAgent::is_dom_content_loaded_ on document element creation
entry.content:
As described in crbug.com/328161303, there seem to be ways of

navigating a frame without firing DidStartNavigation() and

DidCommitProvisionalLoad().



In such a case, is_dom_content_loaded_ is not reset, which means

AutofillAgent extracts forms during page load.



This CL resets is_dom_content_loaded_ also when a new document element

is created.

entry.title: [Uno-D][passwords] Disable confirmation dialog for account storage
entry.content:
When browser signin is explicit, account storage is enabled by default.



For UNO users:

- removes the confirmation dialog when toggling the setting. Passwords

can be enabled without confirmation from settings.

- promos for account storage are removed (e.g. on form filling)

- password generation is disabled (menu entry is removed) when account

storage is opted out.

- the drop-down menu in the password bubble is NOT addressed by this

CL. This drop-down menu is being removed by a separate effort.

entry.title: Refactor FilesScanData to minimize copies.
entry.content:
FilesScanData now moves the list of paths to expand to the bckground

thread instead of copying the list. The list is passed back to

FilesScanData when the expansion is complete.



Also adds a method to ContentAnalysis Delegate to encapsulate enterprise

business logic and share more more code between access points that

perform content analysis of files. This hides the use of FilesScanData

inside enterprise code.

entry.title: [ios] Add missing dependencies on swift_source_set(...) targets
entry.content:
When running `gn check ...` the Objective-C header generated from

the Swift source by the Swift compiler is ignored by gn and thus

the corresponding dependency is not reported if missing. This can

lead to flaky build (or build considered as dirty).



This CL adds the missing dependencies. They were found by changing

the template swift_source_set(...) to declare a secondary target

listing the generated file as input, running `gn check ...` and

fixing the errors.



Note: eventually the bug in `gn check ...` should be fixed, but

this CL is improving the situation and should land before the

underlying issue is fixed.



Bug: https://crbug.com/gn/361

Bug: 326059372

entry.title: [ios] Implement unified BookmarkModel instance behind flag
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



This patch uses `syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage`, which

is disabled by default, to determine whether there should be a single

BookmarkModel instance per BrowserState (if flag enabled) or whether

there should be two of them (if flag disabled).



The design principle is that the flag is, barring a few exceptions,

implemented inside the three existing bookmark-related factories on iOS.

The publicly-observable API and behavior behind these factories does not

change depending on the feature flag, but internally the plumbing

changes significantly.



A key piece that makes this possible is the newly-introduced class

`LegacyBookmarkModelWithSharedUnderlyingModel`, which is able to expose

a split view (i.e. subset of a larger BookmarkModel instance). Most of

the functionality is included in this patch, except for observer

handling which will be tackled in follow-up patches, as well as more

advanced needs like dealing with null permanent folders.



Design doc (sorry, Googlers only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/11Dm4-FWEpT_fgxfAeq16O8qxOtaOZbU2o3MZeHDByUM/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 326185948

entry.title: [DataSharing] Add platform-agnostic group-related API skeleton
entry.content:
This CL adds new methods (not yet implemented) to DataSharingService,

that provides API to access/edit group data, needed to implement the UI

and maybe few other things. Java counterpart is to be added in a follow

up.



DataSharingService diverges from SDK:

1. Most of the methods work with singular, e.g. there is no batch group

editing operations. This likely suits all our needs and slightly simpler

to use.

2. API uses dedicated data structures, decoupling them early from DB

protos (coming soon) and SDK protos should give us more flexibility in

the future in case we prefer to diverge from them more.

3. Instead of using single UpdateGroup(Action), there are dedicated

methods, such as AddMember()/RemoveMember(). The reasoning is similar

to 1., on top of that this makes API more constrained -> perhaps harder

to misuse / better compile-time checks.



Bug: 301389859

entry.title: Mojo cpp bindings generator: avoid redundant version checks.
entry.content:
Previously, the variable `last_checked_version` doesn't work

as expected. The scoping behavior of Jinja prevents variable

update from persisting across for-loop runs. As a result,

generated struct validation code has a version check for

each field whose min_version > 0, even when there are

multiple fields belonging to the same version:



```

if (object->header_.version < 31)

return true;

if (!mojo::internal::ValidateStruct(object->foo, validation_context))

return false;



if (object->header_.version < 31)

return true;

if (!mojo::internal::ValidateStruct(object->bar, validation_context))

return false;

```



This CL uses a namespace object to fix that.



BUG=None



Change-Id: I32ed34a66e440512e6150b51fa137cf2be03f18f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5348038

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

entry.title: Update a way user integrity is used in tests
entry.content:
With changes in this CL the cleanup strategy for the user is recorded

at creation time and is used once misconfigured user is detected.



It ensures that --cryptohome-ignore-cleanup-ownership-for-testing

switch in tests is taken into account at the user creation time

and can not be lost upon occasional chrome restart (that would also

trigger user cleanup).

entry.title: Use CSSValuePhase for image values
entry.content:
Gradient color stops may or may not need to resolve currentcolor

depending on whether computed or resolved value is needed. Pass this

information down from property handlers through classes for CSS image

types.
